Yes Mr Xun! They're primarily meant for track use to reduce brake fade and make sure they can function at a higher Temperature for longer. For road use not that good. Also not too much of value for hardcore track use as well as you will need new brakes after a few track days  at which point  it can be a very expensive task to get new ceramic rotors as compared to regular steel rotors
